title: HRG seals deal with US Embassy | Buying
text:
0 comments Rob Gill Mon, 21 Sep 2015 10:15 Follow @BBT_online HRG has won a five-year contract to manage travel for the US Embassy in China.
The UK-based travel management giant will organise corporate travel for US consulates around China including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenyang, Wuhan and Chengdu.
HRG will be providing on-site services for the US Embassy as part of the contract.
CEO David Radcliffe said: “ We are very proud to announce the US Embassy as one of our newest clients. It is another progressive step for us as we continue to grow our global government services.
“The business was awarded to HRG because of our expertise and knowledge in this specialist sector. We will be measured on our excellent customer service together with our ability to provide a truly one stop shop for embassy and consulate travellers.”
HRG also provides travel management services to the UK central government and the Government of Canada.
